Field Label:
This supervision checklist is designed to assess the functionality and performance of health facilities across key thematic areas of the immunization program. 
It provides a structured approach for supervisors to evaluate service delivery practices, cold chain management, data quality, human resource capacity, community linkages, and support supervision mechanisms. 
The tool supports scoring and classification of facility performance using the maturity model (Bronze-Silver-Gold), enabling targeted mentorship, performance tracking, and continuous quality improvement across counties and sub-counties.

NB - This is an evaluation- the next time a supervision is done in November, we shall use KHIS Tracker as directed by the program
Please enter your names as the data collector

Field Label: 1. Are immunization sessions conducted according to the immunization schedule and policy guidelines?
Field Note: Verify: Review session plan; observe session. - if no plan present mark no and specify in the comments section

Field Label: 2. Are outreach sessions reaching targeted hard-to-reach / zero-dose populations?
Field Note: Verify: Outreach plan & reports; outreach register. If YES, capture numbers below.

Field Label:
3. If YES: How many Zero Dose Children were Immunized in Q1 and Q2 below ?

Q1 2025 (Jan - Mar) {sd_zero_dose_q1}
Q2 2025 (Apr - Jun) {sd_zero_dose_q2}
Q3 2025 (Jul-Sep) {sd_zero_dose_q3}
Q 4 (Oct- Present) {sd_zero_dose_q4}
4. Are defaulter-tracing mechanisms in place and functional in the facility?
Field Note: Verify: defaulter register / tickler box / eCHIS line list. - NB Mark No if the Facility Does not Track Defaulters

Field Label: 8. If NO Defaulter Tracing Mechanisms are available at the Facility: Note challenges experienced at the facility
Field Note: Please note any Challenges to using existing DT methods available

Field Label: 9. Are infection prevention & safety practices followed during sessions (hand hygiene, AEFI preparedness, safe injection)?
Field Note: Verify: Direct observation.

Field Label: 10. Is service delivery client-friendly (waiting time, privacy, counselling)?
Field Note: Verify: Observe client flow; brief client interview; NB - This needs to be according to the EPI's assessment - client friendly time is less than an nour before new vial  is open

Verify: Observe & interview. - i.e are doses correctly open during sessions, how long are vials discarded after opening per antigen? Is Rota kept for 28 days after opening the vial or discared after 6 hours ? etc

Field Label: 12. Is the screening tool (stamp) available at the facility ?
Field Note: Confirm if the screening stamp is available at the facility

Field Label: 13. If YES, are staff trained on use of the screening tool?
Field Note: Ask the staff available if they know how to use the screening tool without giving them directions

Field Label: 14. Is the screening tool in use at the facility i.e do they currently use it to identify missed opportunities for Imunization ?
15.How does the facility currently receord number of children screened using the tool and where does the tool currently sit in relation to the MCH
Field Note: Briefly document if the facility has any mechanism to record screened / referred children - Enter N/A where tool available but no records available

Field Label: 1. Are infection prevention and safety practices consistently followed?

Field Label: 2. Does the facility have all the requisite disposal materials ? From yellow bin liners to safety boxes, etc ?

Field Label: 4. Is there a waste management plan available and in use?
Field Note: Verify: Document on site; staff knowledgeable.

Field Label: 5. Does the Health Facility have 9 or more months of sharps still at the facility awaiting discarding ?

Field Label: 9. Section Comments / Findings on Injection Safety & Waste Management
Field Note: Enter feedback on waste management and injetion safety that you feel are important but are not included in the list of questions

Field Label: 1. Are ALL vaccine refrigerators functional and properly maintained?
Field Note: Verify: Observe records (job cards where available). NB - Only mark if ALL equipment is  functional at the facility

Field Label: 2. Are VVMs checked and noted at discard point before administration?
Field Note: Verify: Inspect vials; record VVM stage. - Observe from a session at the facility and in the fridge

Field Label: 3. Are dynamic expiry dates clearly indicated on opened vials?
Field Note: Verify: Inspect vial labelling for thawed vaccines where applicable.

Field Label: 4. Are stock levels accurately recorded and up to date?
Field Note: Verify: Bin cards/eLMIS vs physical count. vs ledger book

Field Label: 5. Have there been any vaccines stocked out over the last 3 months?
Field Note: If YES, list items & duration; trigger replenishment/redistribution.
